Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: Not the usual Swiss procedure, Mr. Bond, but you understand, a man in my position..

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Which is neutral, no doubt.

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: It wasn't easy, but I retrieved the money.  No doubt Sir Robert will be pleased to see it again.

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: In the current exchange rate, minus the fees, of course, and certain unforeseeable expenses. Here is the receipt...

Speaker: cigar girl
Dialogue: Would you like to check my figures?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Perhaps later.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: My glasses.

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: It's all there.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I didn't come for the money. The report you sold him was stolen from an MI-6 agent, who was killed for it.

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: I did not get the report from an MI-6 agent.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who did you get it from?

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: I am just a middle man. I am doing the honourable thing and returning the money to its rightful owner...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And we know how difficult that can be for the Swiss.

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: Your last chance. Take the money.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Your last chance. Give me the name.

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: Stripped of all your weaponry, you still threaten me?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Perhaps you failed to take into account my...hidden assets.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The name?

Speaker: lachaise
Dialogue: I can't tell you...  Alright, alright! But you must protect me!

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: What's his name? Our friend from MI-6?

Speaker: cigar girl
Dialogue: James Bond.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: One of M's more accomplished tin soldiers.

Speaker: cigar girl
Dialogue: He could identify me.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: If it concerns you...kill him.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Let's toast this James Bond.  We're in his hands now...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Have this checked, see what you can get off it.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: James.  Brought me a souvenir from Geneva?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Thought you might want one of these.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: She's in with Sir Robert.

Speaker: sir robert
Dialogue: Thanks for getting my money back --never expected to see it again.  You're the kind of man I could use.  Though I won't offend certain parties by asking you to join King Industries.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Construction's not exactly my line.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Old friend?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who buys classified reports for three million pounds.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Someone was watching over me in Geneva. A guardian angel with a laser sight.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: King.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Security --

Speaker: sir robert
Dialogue: Thanks, but I'll count it myself.  Lifetime habit.  I'm Scottish.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Stop!  King!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Beautiful, isn't it?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Today, of all days, the sun decides to shine.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Perhaps Sir Robert had a word with the Man Upstairs.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: A word? I'm sure by now he's engineered a hostile takeover.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You knew him well?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: He was my father.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: He died before he could complete his lifelong dream.  I intend to finish it for him.

Speaker: older man
Dialogue: Elektra!

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: She's not a girl anymore.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It's barely a scratch. The Dome broke my fall.

Speaker: doctor greatrex
Dialogue: Dislocated collar bone.  If any more tendons snap...  It won't just be two weeks out of action.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I need you to pass me fit now, Molly.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It's just a scratch.

Speaker: doctor greatrex
Dialogue: James.  It wouldn't really be...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Ethical?  Can't we just skirt the issue?

Speaker: doctor greatrex
Dialogue: ...if you showed sufficient...willpower. Promised to slow down.  Cut out running, jumping...shooting.  All kinds of...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Strenuous activity?

Speaker: doctor greatrex
Dialogue: Then maybe I'd be... open to that.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Perhaps after this ... test?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I could come for a second opinion?

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: ...The money was dipped in urea, dried, and packed tight. In one note the metal strip had been replaced with a combustible magnesium circuit -- in effect a tiny detonator. King always wore a pin in his lapel, an heirloom called 'the Eye of the Glens'; but someone switched it for a copy, a ceramic micro- circuit emitting an electronic signature.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: When he came within range of the money -- boom.  Ingenious.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: And expensive.  Cost three million plus.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Caviar capital of the world. Matchless beluga. Firm, yet subtle.  Largest landlocked body of water on Earth.  Oil-rich.  Hitler wanted it. Stalin beat him to it.

Speaker: robinson
Dialogue: Latest estimates, six trillion dollars. It'll make the Gulf look like a puddle, see us right through the new century. The problem is getting the oil out of there.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: So Sir Robert's goes through Turkey, direct to the Med...?

Speaker: robinson
Dialogue: A huge project. The most expensive of the pipelines, but the one supported by every Western leader. None of the American oil companies were willing to take it on. But King has connections to the region. He married into the Vavra family, rich local industrialists. He used those connections to hold it all together.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Kill the man, kill the pipeline.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Your call to the PM.

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: ...somehow managed to shoot two of her captors and escape...

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: ... the leader, the one who escaped.  Can you describe him?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: He shouted.  He shouted all the time --

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Tell me about the kidnapping of Elektra King.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I took the initiative.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I was the one who brought that money in...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The amount of money that killed Robert King is the same amount as the ransom demand for Elektra.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Whoever kidnapped Elektra is the same man who killed her father.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Renard.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sacrifice the girl to take out the terrorist?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He survived?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: 'That which does not kill me makes me stronger.'

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He's not through yet. Renard doesn't blow up five million dollars unless he knows there's more coming in. He's working for someone. Someone who wants to stop the pipeline.  And they hired the perfect killer. One with a vendetta against King...and you.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: He's always been good at oral exams.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The worm on the hook again.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Scottish heavy metal, Q?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And other uses, no doubt.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: That would make you..."R"?

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: Bond. A government man. I'm afraid since you English got the boss killed we've been a little...jumpy.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'd rather you didn't play with that.

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: Nice.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Quite stunning.

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: Sorry about all that, comrade. Old habits die hard. I am Head of Security. Davidov.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: ...they should have been in place two days ago. That is the target my father set.

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: We've had some trouble with the villagers at Ruan. Some sacred burial plot...

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: Miss King...James Bond here to see you.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Find me the research on the limestone deposits, go ahead and place these orders, and get the jeep ready. I will go to Ruan myself...

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: Miss King, I wouldn't recommend...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I said, I will go.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Would you excuse us, Davidov?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I met you at my father's funeral.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I haven't been able to recall a single moment of that day...until now.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Funerals aren't exactly memorable.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: God no. All those horrible loved ones and relatives. I don't want to talk to those people. I just want to...talk to my father.  I loved him.  I'm not sure he knew that.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Is that why you want to finish the pipeline?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Partially, yes.

Speaker: gabor
Dialogue: The jeep is ready, Ma'am.  Will I be driving with you?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: No, Gabor. We have a guest.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who is he?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: My bodyguard. He follows me everywhere. He's decisive, vigilant.  And he makes an excellent omelette.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How long has he been with you?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Since the kidnapping. Why do you ask?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Does this look familiar to you?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: It's my father's pin. He wore it everyday of his life.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Are you trying to break my heart? Or is it just your way with women?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It's not the pin your father wore. It's an exact duplicate. Inside is a tiny electrical detonator. We have reason to believe the assassin had an inside accomplice, someone who worked at this company.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: If you've come here to look after me, Mr. Bond, thank you, but no thank you.  I have two bodyguards, I don't need a third...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The killer doesn't want to see this pipeline continue, doesn't want to see you take over...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: That's every man within a five mile radius.  Including you.  That's why you're here, isn't it? You think I can't do it. You think I'm going to screw up. Or get myself killed.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I think running this pipeline would be a difficult job for anyone. Especially King's daughter.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You are wrong, Mr. Bond. In fact, I am the only person who can do it.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: My mother's people discovered oil here ninety years ago.  The Bolsheviks slaughtered them for it.  Will be one of the main arteries...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Send the pipe around.

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: It will take weeks, cost millions. Your father approved this route.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Then my father was wrong.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I have to check the upper lines.  Gabor will drive you back.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Always wanted to see the upper lines.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You don't take no for an answer, do you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Alright then. Do you ski?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I've been known to.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Can't land.  Wind's too strong!

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Just hold her steady.  You wanted to see it.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: We're building from both ends.  This is where they'll meet.  Fifteen hundred miles from the Caspian to the Mediterranean.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Head for that gully, I'll lure them into the trees!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Should have stuck to snowboarding.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Are they gone? All of them?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Hold on to me.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Oh my God...we're buried alive...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We're alright.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I can't stay here.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You're not going to.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: No!  It will cave in!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It's the only way out...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I can't breathe, I can't breathe...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Elektra, look at me, look in my eyes!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: She's fine. Contusions. A slight strain to her ankle, but otherwise, fine.  She wants to see you.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Are you alright?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I can't stay.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I need to ask you something.  And I need you to tell me the truth.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Who is it? Who is trying to kill me?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I don't know. But I will find him.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: After the kidnapping...I was afraid to go outside, to be alone, to be in a crowd, to do anything at all, until I realized...  There's no point in living if you can't...feel alive.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I can't huddle in the shadows. I can't let fear run my life.  I won't.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: The way I acted, in the snow...you must think I'm a coward.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I think you're one of the bravest people I've ever met.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...you should rest.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: James...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I have to go.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Then take me with you.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: No. You'll be safe here.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I don't want to be safe!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I have to go to work.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Now who's the coward?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Valentin Zukovsky.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: BondJamesBond. What brings you here?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You, of course. I need some information.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Bond, I'm a civilian. This is my place. Used to be the royal family's, now it's mine. I run my little business, I stay out of trouble...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Mafia warlords, Diplomats and spies, consortiums from every country in the world.  A nice little rat's nest.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Have some of the rat's nest caviar.  From my own fishery.  They buy my caviar, drink my champagne, lose to my House.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Let me introduce you to a former colleague of mine at the KGB. Dmitri Palov, you may know him as...the Boa.

Speaker: boa
Dialogue: The great 007. For years I have dreamed of closing my hands around your neck.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Boa. Have you had any therapy since Perestroika?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Why am I suddenly worried I'm not carrying enough insurance?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: See?  You're upsetting my customers. What do you want?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How does a terrorist like Renard supply his men with state-of-the-art Russian Army weapons?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: What?  This is not possible.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: If I remember my Cyrillic that says 101st airborne division.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Where did you get this?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Off a high-powered Paraski that was trying to kill me.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: The Russian Army, they spend millions on flying skis, but they cannot afford to pay the soldiers. The men, they do what they have to do to feed their families. In this country, for the right price and a pack of cigarettes, you can get anything you want.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: That too. Everyone does what they can to survive.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How high up does this...arms dealing go?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Bond. If someone wants you dead, it is Renard. Our government has nothing to gain by killing you.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: But you would have something to gain by killing Robert King. And stopping his pipeline.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Poor Bond. The cold war is over.  What have you got left? Economic espionage. Murder in the boardroom.  So dull.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Oh, you'd be surprised.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: We've kept your father's chair free.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: And his account?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: You have a credit line of a million and a half.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Vodka martini.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Two. Shaken not stirred.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing here?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: What are you doing here?  Looking for a woman a little more your type? How about that one?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: If this little show is for my benefit, I'll take you home right now.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You had your chance, James. Now I'm looking for a bigger thrill.

Speaker: hooker
Dialogue: You want to be...on top, or not on top?

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: On top.

Speaker: hooker
Dialogue: Tied up, or not tied up?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Dead, or not dead?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I understand it's normally good practice to get the feel of the cards before going off the deep end.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: dealer
Dialogue: Bust.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I like the deep end, James.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Is this how you spend the money I pay you? And with the rest you hire fools who shoot like blind men?

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: Bond...

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Should be dead as well. Your failure today is astonishing.  It is a disgrace.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Do you know why the color is blue at the wick?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Because that is where the flame is the hottest.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: The temperature is close to five hundred degrees.

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: The plane...it's all been arranged...

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Then you are completely unnecessary...

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: I have the documents, the landing authorizations, the security passes...

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Bond is suspicious. We are moving sooner, tonight.  We understand each other?

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: Yes...yes...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Stand or split them.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Surely you believe in living dangerously.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Not at that price. Time to surrender.

Speaker: dealer
Dialogue: The House has no limit.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Hit me.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Time to surrender.

Speaker: davidov
Dialogue: A little accident.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: A night of burning passion?

Speaker: henchman
Dialogue: Sir?  Sir?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: I will take care of Mister Bond.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You knew when you first saw me.  You knew it would be like this.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Shush.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Poor shoulder. Looks painful...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...needs constant attention...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Enough ice for one day.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You never take this off?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Why do men always want to undress the one part of a woman's body she doesn't want to reveal?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How did you survive?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I used my body on the guards.  It gave me control. I got to a gun and I took my chance.  I've never told anyone that.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Do you ever stop, James?  Do you ever think about...another kind of life?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I can't afford to.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Don't worry. I know who you are.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Problem, comrade?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Old habits die hard.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Here goes nothing.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Romashka.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: You have fifteen minutes.

Speaker: colonel akakievich
Dialogue: You are late. The transport documents?

Speaker: colonel akakievich
Dialogue: They are waiting for you below.  It should be ready. Check with the IDA physicist.

Speaker: colonel akakievich
Dialogue: Not interested in men. Take my word for it.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: You new?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes. Viktor Davidov, Miss...?

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Doctor. Jones. Christmas Jones. No jokes, I've heard them all.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Don't know any doctor jokes.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What happened to Len Tashka?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Couldn't make it. Splitting headache.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: The soldiers may give you a hard time. Whatever. If we weren't around, they'd have their whole nuclear arsenal lying by the roadsides, rotting in the sun.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Will I need protection?

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: There's no radiation danger down there.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Where is this stockpile going?

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: See the corporal, at the end of the chamber.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Corporal?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: I see my friend Davidov ran into some difficulty.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Indeed.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Don't come any closer.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: You can't kill me. I'm already dead.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Go ahead.  Shoot.  My men will still steal the bomb, and the shot will bring them directly to you.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who's paying you to destroy the pipeline?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: To die by a man who can't even grasp what he's caught up in...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Revenge isn't so hard to fathom. What's clever is getting someone else to pay for it.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Not many people in this world have that kind of fortune.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who is it?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: You think I fear death? I welcome it. I get on my knees and pray for it. You, on the other hand, you have something to live for, no?  She's beautiful isn't she? You should have seen her before. Flawless, and still so innocent, not such a whore in bed...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You will never touch her. You will never get near her.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Have you forgotten who saved your life in Geneva?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Consider me ungrateful.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: It's I who should thank you -- for taking that money back to MI-6.  So distressing for M.  An explosion inside her lair.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: She'll get over it.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: You even brought the plane for us.  We really couldn't have done it without you.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: A man tires of being executed.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: But then again...There is no point in living if you can't...feel alive.

Speaker: colonel akakievich
Dialogue: Drop your gun.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Keep away, Colonel.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: He is an impostor.  There's no Davidov at Miratom.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Here's your imposter. He's paid off the men on the plane outside.  They're not taking the bomb to any Russian facility, they're flying it wherever he tells them.

Speaker: colonel akakievich
Dialogue: I said drop it.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: were you the one who allowed him down?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: You had me.  I knew you couldn't shoulder the responsibility...

Speaker: colonel akakievich
Dialogue: No -- the bomb does not go anywhere until I am satisfied.  All of you to the surface, now...

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Very well, Colonel. We will all go up.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Shut them.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Melt-down doors.  If he gets them closed, they won't be opened again for forty- eight years.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: We have our fireworks.  Now you can have yours.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Close the door!  Close the door!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Shame you had to spot I wasn't the real thing.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: So who are you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Bond --

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: James Bond.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: They won't get far. Every warhead has a locator card.  A Miratom device.  Emits a high-pitched signal on Russian emergency frequencies. We can track the bomb.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: With this?

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Anywhere in this circle.  Iran, Iraq, Pakistan, Syria, Afghanistan...

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Elektra King is calling from Baku.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: It's a video line.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I would never call you except...Bond's disappeared. He...he left my villa, some time in the middle of the night and...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: My head of security has been found near a local airstrip, murdered...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Could...could you come?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I just can't help thinking...I'm next.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Gabor...?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: James!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You look surprised.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: What's wrong with you?  Are you crazy?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: A little. Does it matter? After all, what's the point of living if you can't feel alive?  Isn't that right, Elektra? Isn't that your motto?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Or did you steal it from your old friend Renard?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: ...what?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We had a run-in, he and I. He knew about us, he knew about my shoulder, he knew exactly where to hurt me...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Are you saying...Renard is the man who's trying to kill me?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You can drop the act, it's over.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I think you do.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: At MI-6 we call it Stockholm Syndrome. It's common in kidnappings.  A young impressionable victim. Sheltered, sexually inexperienced. A powerful kidnapper skilled in torture, in manipulation. Something snaps in the victim's mind. The captive falls in love with her captor.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: How dare you!  How dare you! That animal!?  That monster!? He disgusts me! You disgust me!  So he knew where to hurt you, is that it? You had a sling on your arm at the funeral! I didn't have to sleep with you to find that out.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He used your exact words.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You knew.  You knew all the time, that he was out there, that he was coming for me, and you lied. You used me, you used me as bait. You made love to me -- what, to pass the time as you waited for him to strike?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: He's struck again.  Five men are dead at the pipeline.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'm coming with you.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You do what you have to do, but I've called in M.  She's en route from London even now.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: They hit about 90 minutes ago. There's a scientist here from the International Decommissioning Agency, Dr. Jones.  She has ten crews combing the area.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: I'll see how they're coming with the power...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The report King bought. It's a manual. Renard's men used it to remove this radio tracking device from the warhead.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: They're getting their weapons from the Russians, but where are they getting the money to buy the weapons?  I can't help thinking...the person close to King, the one who switched that pin...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Is maybe...the inside woman.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: That's not right.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: It's an observation and repair rig. Travels along the pipe, checks for broken seals.  But it's not supposed to be there.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Stop it.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: I don't understand...

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: It's heading for the oil terminal.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: My God.  Have the terminal evacuated.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Speed?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: Full on.  Seventy miles an hour.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: One hundred and six miles from the terminal.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Any more of these rigs?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: There's one parked in the passageway ahead of it.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: I'll need some help...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Unless you'd like to see my ID first.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Good luck.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Be one along any minute.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: When this is over we should bury the hatchet. Celebrate. A champagne dinner?

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: When this is over our bodies may be blown to smithereens.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Alright then, brunch.

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: Tanner reports Bond is headed for the rendezvous.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You can evacuate my workers, but I'm not going anywhere.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Faster! Get our speed up!

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Tactical fission device.  Low yield.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: The plutonium is missing.  They've taken the core!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Then it's no longer a bomb?

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: It's a bomb alright. We're still dead if the trigger charge goes off...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Let it blow.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: But we can stop it.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Let it blow.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Trust me.  Leave it.

Speaker: gabor
Dialogue: It wasn't nuclear...the bomb was a dud. The trigger charge blew out a fifty yard section of pipeline...

Speaker: gabor
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Do you think he's dead?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I have a gift for you.  Something that belonged to my father. He would have wanted you to have it.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Please.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: He often spoke of how...compassionately you advised him on the best course of action during my kidnapping.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: It's very valuable, you know. I just couldn't let it explode with the rest of him.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Take her to the chopper.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What the hell were you doing?  You nearly killed us!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I did kill us. She thinks we're dead. And she thinks she got away with it.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What the hell are you talking about?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It's part of some plan. She dresses it up like a terrorist attack.  The explosion covers up the theft of the plutonium.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Who's she?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Elektra King.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Elektra King?  Are you insane?  This is her pipeline.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Makes her look even more innocent.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What would she want with weapons grade plutonium?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I was hoping you could tell me.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: You steal an old bomb, small by today's standards, about the size of the one that destroyed Nagasaki, take the plutonium core out of it, intending to use it...  To make a bigger, better bomb.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: I have to get after that core.  This is my ass.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Tanner to 007, do you read?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Loud and clear.  I have to speak to M.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: She's gone.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: She's disappeared.  And two of our men have been killed.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: She just upped the stakes. All her chips are on the table now.  And M's life is part of the bet.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I know I promised you champagne, but would you settle for caviar?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You're hurting me.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Brought me something?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Go on.  It's safe.  Touch your destiny.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Warm.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Is it?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I've brought something for you as well.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Just as I promised.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: My executioner.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Your people? Your people will leave you here to rot just like you left me. You and my father. He didn't think my life was worth the chump change he spent on a day at the stock market.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Is nothing.  His kingdom he stole from my mother. The kingdom I will rightly take back.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: No. I'm afraid it is what you did.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: When I took her she was...promise itself. So clever, so vibrant, so...full of life force. And you left her there, at the mercy of a man like me. You ruined her. For what?  To get to me? She is worth fifty of me.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: No. I wanted you. I wanted you for myself.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Since you sent your man to kill me, I have been watching time tick slowly away, marching inevitably toward my own death. Watch these hands, M. At noon tomorrow, your time is up. And I guarantee you...I will not miss.  You will die. Along with everyone in this city and the future of the West.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: What are doing, Bond?  Trying to impress this innocent thing?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: She's no innocent.  This is my nuclear consultant.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Ah, I see.  A purely...plutonic relationship.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Really Bond, couldn't you find a nice Russian scientist with hair growing out of his ears?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What's your business with Elektra King?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: I thought you were the one in her business.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: She dropped a million and half dollars to the House -- your House. And you didn't even bat an eyelid.  She was paying you off.  What for?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: As ever you are the spy who has to see a plot wherever he looks.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: That is 5,000 dollars of Beluga ruined!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You are out of your league.  She's working with Renard.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: They've stolen a nuclear device.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Tell us what you know, Zukovsky.  Tell us, before its too late.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Now...where were we?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: A rope!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: No.  The truth!  She thought I was dead -- those blades were meant for you.  What do you know that she would kill you for?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking --

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Help me, don't let me drown.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You're in this thing up to your neck.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Alright, alright!  Sometimes I smuggle machinery for her.  Russian stuff.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And the payoff on the tables?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: A special job.  A...a...a submarine.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: To haul some cargo. My nephew, he is Captain of a sub in the Black Sea Fleet.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where's the sub going?!

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: No!  Get me out!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: This is too big for even you.  Where is it?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: This is a family matter! If my nephew is in danger, we do it my way, or nothing! Now get me out!

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: No! Bond!

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Bond!

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Commander Bond, you are dangerous, unpredictable, and a hothead.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: But then again, explosive devices are my specialty.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: So.  My way.  No MI-6, no Interpol.  Just you, me and my people.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Istanbul.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: So beautiful. So smooth, so warm.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: How would you know?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Why are you like this?  Because Bond is dead?  It's what you wanted.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Of course...

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: He was a...good lover?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: What about this?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: But surely...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: ...You can feel this?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Remember ... pleasure?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Any luck reaching Yevgeny?

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Negative, comrade.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What is this place?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Former KGB surveillance post. The Dye Factory was just a front; now it turns a good profit.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Your old friend Dmitri.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Today, you are glad to have the Boa  on your side.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: In the good old days, the KGB had three or four spots where our submarines could surface without anyone knowing. But Yevgeny is supposed to be loading cargo.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What class sub does your nephew run?

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: C-class.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Nuclear.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Not just nuclear. Powered by a nuclear reactor.  He's not loading any cargo. They want the sub. The sub itself. Put weapons grade plutonium inside the sub's reactor: Instant, catastrophic meltdown.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Made to look just like an accident.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Mother of God.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The right kind of explosion in the right spot -- it would block the Bosphorus, cut off the Black Sea.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: But why? Eight million people would die, the land irradiated for a hundred years. A cloud of radiation the size of Europe...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Because an explosion like that would kill all the other pipelines. There would be only one way to get the oil out of the Caspian and pump it to the world...

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: The King pipeline.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Elektra would control it all.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: If what you say it true...it may be too late for Yevgeny.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Captain...

Speaker: yevgeny
Dialogue: Sir. We are ready to load your cargo. We only have a few hours before we'll be missed.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: You came with a skeleton crew?

Speaker: yevgeny
Dialogue: That's all we can afford these days.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Of course. We are grateful for your efforts.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: We have brandy and other refreshments for your men.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: If we're not in time and something has happened to him... you must let me kill them.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Whoever gets there first, Zukovsky.  They have M.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Take them up and throw them in the sea.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: We'll be underway in two hours.  Use that time to re-familiarize yourselves with your stations. Then ponder how rich you'll be.  The re-breathers for the escape are already on board.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Now you know how it feels.  To be locked away, to wonder if they're coming for you, if anyone will ever come for you.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Who?  Bond?  Bond is dead.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Somehow, I find that strangely ...disappointing.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Time for you to die.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: The reactor is secured.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: This is the end.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: No.  It is the beginning. The world will never be the same.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: It will be yours, and yours alone. Have fun with it.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Comrade, it's faint, but I'm getting something. A signal. Transmitting at...37- 19 degrees north...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The locator card. It's M.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The rest?

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Forty, forty-three degrees East...

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: The Maiden's Tower.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How appropriate.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: I'd heard there were some renovations there...no one would look for a sub in that place in a million years.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Zukovsky...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: If I don't get to the Boa before he gets to Maiden's Tower, M is dead.

Speaker: boa
Dialogue: For years I was told I could never take the great James Bond and his Walther PPK. What good is your gun now, Bond?

Speaker: gabor
Dialogue: Welcome aboard, Mr. Bond.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: James Bond and his amazing resurrection. If only you'd kept away, we might have met again in a few years, become lovers once more.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Take her to Renard.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Pretty thing.  You had her too?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I could have given you the world.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Not interested.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: They were digging near here and they found some very pretty vases.  They also found this...  I think we ignore the old ways at our peril, don't you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where's M?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Soon she'll be everywhere.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: All this, because you fell for Renard?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Five more turns and your neck will break.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Since I was a child, I've always had a power over men. When I realized my father wouldn't rescue me from the kidnappers, I knew I had to form a new alliance.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You turned Renard.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Just like you...only you were even easier.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: I told him he had to hurt me, he had to make it look real. When he refused I told him I would do it myself.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: So you killed your father.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: He killed me! He killed me the day he refused to pay my ransom.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Was this all about the oil?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: It is my oil!  Mine and my family's!

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: It runs in my veins, thicker than blood. I'm going to redraw the map. And when I am through the whole world will know my name, my grandfather's name, the glory of my people.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: No-one will believe this melt-down was an accident.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: They will believe.  They will all believe.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You understand? Nobody can resist me.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Know what happens when a man is strangled?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Elektra, it's not too late.  Eight million people needn't die.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You should have killed me when you had the chance.  But you couldn't. Not me.  A woman you've loved.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You meant ... nothing ... to me.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: One... last... screw?

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Oh James.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: I'm looking for a submarine.  It's big and black, and the driver is a friend of mine.

Speaker: zukovsky
Dialogue: Bring it to me.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: What a shame.  You just missed him.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Excuse me.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Everything's under control up here.  Are you ready?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Yes.  Au revoir...

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Zukovsky really hated you.  Time to say goodnight.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: James.  You can't kill me.  Not in cold blood.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Call him off.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I won't ask again.  Call him off!

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Renard.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: You wouldn't kill me.  You'd miss me.

Speaker: elektra
Dialogue: Dive!  Bond --

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I never miss.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How do you want to die?  Or this?

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: James!...

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Is there another way?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We go down to the torpedo bay.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Open the tanks.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Tanks open.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Bond...

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Bond! You have decided to join me on this historic voyage.  Welcome to my nuclear family.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You're really going to commit suicide for her?

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: In case you've forgotten.  I'm dead already.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Haven't you heard the news?  So is she.

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: You will die for this.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: The cover is off the reactor.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He's sealed himself in.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: He's going to insert the plutonium.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Do you know what you're doing?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Like riding a bike.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: What kind of bikes did you ride?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Just wanted to put him on edge...

Speaker: renard
Dialogue: Open the torpedo tubes.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Climb!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Keep moving.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: There's one chance.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Re-breathers.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Never liked those things anyway.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Count to twenty.  When you get to twenty open the hatch.  It can only be opened for a few seconds or we'll sink.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: But what if...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Count to twenty.  I'll be there.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: One, one thousand, two, one thousand...

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Fourteen, one thousand, fifteen, one thousand...

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Twenty.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Christmas!

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: We have to get the rod out of the reactor!

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Melting down.  4000 degrees, the Zirconium casings on the rods crack. 5000, the plutonium melts.  In ten minutes, a hydrogen explosion.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: She's waiting for you.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We're sinking.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: Help me.  We have to seal it.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We've got to get out.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: We can't.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Still no contact yet.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I love Christmas in Turkey.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: So isn't it time you unwrapped your present?

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: That's strange.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: He must be nearby.

Speaker: christmas
Dialogue: You know James...  I think Christmas is coming early this year.
